ground_truth: Lockhart flies upwards, hits the roof of the cave and falls. The cave roof starts to collapse. The passage between Ron and Harry is completely blocked. Harry peers through a tiny gap in the rocks. Lying on the ground, Lockhart smiles vacantly. He picks up a stone. Ron grabs the stone and hits him over the head with it. Harry climbs over fallen rocks. Holding his wand in his hand, he starts to explore the cave. On the wall ahead, he sees a circular hinged door decorated with a pattern of snakes. He goes towards it, and starts to speak. One snake glides around the circumference, unlocking the mechanism. The heavy metal door swings open. Holding his wand as protection, Harry walks warily through the circular opening of the long and narrow tunnel. He climbs down the few rungs of a short metal ladder and jumps off at the bottom. He finds himself in a long, damp chamber. Ahead of him runs a wide paved path lined on either side by huge carved snake heads, their stone mouths gaping open. Harry walks towards the massive carved head of a bearded man illuminated with a green light. The head is reflected in the water beneath. He sees the still figure of a girl lying on the wet stone floor. He runs towards her and kneels beside her. Her face is pale and her eyes are closed. Harry looks around and sees Tom Riddle in the shadows. He picks up Harry's wand. Harry gets up and holds out his hand. He writes fiery letters in the air with Harry's wand. Harry stares at him. They glare angrily at each other. They both look up. The phoenix drops something into Harry's hand. The handsome bird swipes away down the chamber. Harry unrolls the crumpled sorting hat and looks at it in surprise. Riddle stretches out his hand. The mouth of the huge bearded statue starts to open. Harry watches in fascinated horror as the huge stone mouth opens wider and wider. A gigantic serpent slithers out. Harry drops the hat and runs. The serpent splashes through the water beneath the statue. It slithers ominously after Harry, who trips and falls. Harry cowers, protecting his head, as the serpent prepares to strike. Fawkes suddenly reappears. The phoenix flies at the serpent's head, flapping its wings; the brave bird pecks repeatedly at the other creature's huge yellow eyes. Riddle calls out angrily. Fawkes swoops off. Harry scrambles to his feet. He backs away as the serpent thrashes his head. The serpent feels his footsteps and lunges forward. Harry makes a dash for it. He splashes through a shallow pool with the huge serpent close behind him.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Lockhart soars upward, strikes the ceiling of the cavern and descends. The cavern ceiling begins to crumble. The corridor between Ron and Harry is entirely obstructed. Harry gazes through a tiny opening in the stones. Lying on the earth, Lockhart grins blankly. He picks up a rock. Ron seizes the rock and strikes him over the head with it. Harry climbs over toppled stones. Holding his wand in his hand, he begins to investigate the cavern. On the wall ahead, he notices a round pivot door adorned with a motif of serpents. He proceeds toward it, and starts to speak. One serpent slides around the perimeter, unlocking the mechanism. The heavy metallic door swings open. Holding his wand as defense, Harry walks cautiously through the round entrance of the extended and narrow passageway. He climbs down the few steps of a short metallic ladder and jumps off at the base. He finds himself in a long, moist chamber. Ahead of him runs a wide paved walkway lined on either side by enormous sculpted serpent heads, their stone jaws agape. Harry walks towards the colossal sculpted head of a bearded man illuminated with a green glow. The head is mirrored in the water below. He sees the motionless figure of a girl lying on the wet stone floor. He runs towards her and kneels beside her. Her face is pale and her eyes are shut. Harry looks around and sees Tom Riddle in the shadows. He picks up Harry's wand. Harry rises and extends his hand. He inscribes fiery symbols in the air with Harry's wand. Harry glares at him. They glare angrily at one another. They both look up. The phoenix drops something into Harry's hand. The attractive bird sweeps away down the chamber. Harry unfurls the crumpled sorting hat and looks at it in astonishment. Riddle extends his hand. The mouth of the enormous bearded sculpture begins to open. Harry watches in captivated terror as the enormous stone mouth opens wider and wider. A gigantic snake slithers out. Harry drops the hat and runs. The snake splashes through the water below the sculpture. It slithers menacingly after Harry, who stumbles and falls. Harry crouches, shielding his head, as the snake prepares to strike. Fawkes abruptly reappears. The phoenix flies at the snake's head, flapping its wings; the courageous bird pecks repeatedly at the other creature's huge yellow eyes. Riddle shouts angrily. Fawkes swoops off. Harry scrambles to his feet. He backs away as the snake thrashes his head. The snake senses his footsteps and lunges forward. Harry makes a sprint for it. He splashes through a shallow pond with the enormous snake close behind him.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Upwards, Lockhart is flown, and the roof of the cave is hit by him, causing him to fall. The roof of the cave starts to collapse. The passage between Ron and Harry completely blocks. Through a tiny gap in the rocks, Harry peers. On the ground, Lockhart is lying and smiles vacantly. A stone is picked up by him. The stone is grabbed by Ron, who hits him over the head with it. Over the fallen rocks, Harry climbs. His wand is held in his hand as the cave is explored by him. A circular hinged door decorated with a pattern of snakes is seen by him on the wall ahead. Towards it, he goes, and speaking is started by him. Around the circumference, one snake glides, unlocking the mechanism. The heavy metal door is swung open. Through the circular opening of the long and narrow tunnel, Harry walks warily, holding his wand as protection. Down a few rungs of a short metal ladder, he climbs and jumps off at the bottom. In a long, damp chamber, he finds himself. Ahead of him, a wide paved path runs lined on either side by huge carved snake heads, their stone mouths gaping open. Towards the massive carved head of a bearded man illuminated with a green light, Harry walks. In the water beneath, the head is reflected. The still figure of a girl lying on the wet stone floor is seen by him. Towards her, he runs and kneels beside her. Her face is pale, and her eyes are closed. Around, Harry looks and sees Tom Riddle in the shadows. Harry's wand is picked up by him. Up, Harry gets and holds out his hand. Fiery letters are written in the air with Harry's wand by Riddle. At him, Harry stares. At each other, they glare angrily. Up, they both look. Something is dropped into Harry's hand by the phoenix. Down the chamber, the handsome bird swipes away. The crumpled sorting hat is unrolled by Harry, and he looks at it in surprise. His hand is stretched out by Riddle. The mouth of the huge bearded statue starts to open. In fascinated horror, Harry watches as the huge stone mouth opens wider and wider. Out slithers a gigantic serpent. The hat is dropped by Harry, who runs. Through the water beneath the statue, the serpent splashes. Ominously, it slithers after Harry, who trips and falls. Harry cowers, protecting his head, as the serpent prepares to strike. Suddenly, Fawkes reappears. At the serpent's head, the phoenix flies, flapping its wings; repeatedly, the brave bird pecks at the creature's huge yellow eyes. Angrily, Riddle calls out. Off, Fawkes swoops. To his feet, Harry scrambles. Away, he backs as the serpent thrashes its head. The footsteps are felt by the serpent, which lunges forward. For it, Harry makes a dash. Through a shallow pool, he splashes with the huge serpent close behind him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Lockhart flies upwards, hits the cave roof, and falls. The ceiling begins to collapse, blocking the passage between Ron and Harry. Peering through a small gap, Harry sees Lockhart on the ground, smiling vacantly. Lockhart picks up a stone, but Ron grabs it and hits him over the head. Harry climbs over fallen rocks, wand in hand, and explores the cave. Ahead, he finds a circular hinged door with a snake pattern. Speaking to the door, a snake glides around its circumference, unlocking it. The heavy metal door swings open, and Harry enters cautiously, wand at the ready. Descending a short metal ladder, he lands in a long, damp chamber. A paved path lined with carved snake heads runs ahead. Harry approaches a massive carved head of a bearded man illuminated by green light, its reflection in the water below. He sees a girl lying on the wet floor and rushes to her side; her face is pale, eyes closed. Spotting Tom Riddle in the shadows, who seizes Harry's wand, they exchange angry glances. The phoenix drops something into Harry's hand and flies away. Surprised, Harry unrolls the crumpled sorting hat. Riddle stretches his hand, causing the statue's mouth to open; a gigantic serpent emerges. Harry drops the hat and runs as the serpent splashes through the water, pursuing him. Tripping, Harry cowers as the serpent prepares to strike. Suddenly, Fawkes reappears, attacking the serpent's eyes. Riddle yells angrily while Fawkes flies away. Harry scrambles to his feet, backing away from the thrashing serpent. Feeling Harry's footsteps, it lunges. Harry dashes through a shallow pool, the serpent close behind.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Lockhart hits the cave roof, triggering its collapse, blocking Ron from Harry. Harry peers through the rocks. Lockhart picks up a stone, which Ron grabs and uses to hit him. Harry climbs over rocks, explores the cave with his wand, and finds a snake-decorated door. He speaks, unlocking it, and enters a narrow tunnel. Descending a ladder, he reaches a damp chamber with a snake-lined path leading to a bearded man's massive head reflected in the water. He sees an unconscious girl and kneels beside her. In the shadows, Tom Riddle takes Harry's wand and writes in the air. They glare angrily. A phoenix drops something into Harry's hand and flies away. Harry finds a sorting hat, but the bearded statue's mouth opens, revealing a serpent. Harry runs, but trips. The serpent approaches, but Fawkes, the phoenix, attacks it, blinding it. Riddle shouts. Fawkes leaves, and Harry escapes as the serpent lunges. He splashes through a pool, serpent close behind.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Lockhart suddenly flies upwards and crashes into the roof of the expansive cave, then plummets back down. The cave's roof begins to tremble and collapse under the disturbance. The narrow passageway between Ron and Harry becomes completely blocked off by fallen debris. Harry, peering intently through a tiny gap in the rocks, sees Lockhart lying sprawled on the ground, smiling vacantly. He picks up a stone lying nearby. Ron, acting quickly, grabs the stone from him and uses it to hit Lockhart over the head. Meanwhile, Harry starts to climb over the fallen rocks, determined to find a way through. Holding his wand firmly in his hand for light and protection, he begins to explore the interior of the cave. On the wall ahead, he notices a circular hinged door intricately decorated with a pattern of entwined snakes. He cautiously moves towards it and begins to speak. One snake on the door glides smoothly around the circumference, unlocking the hidden mechanism. Slowly, the heavy metal door swings open with a creak. Holding his wand defensively as a precautionary measure, Harry walks warily through the circular opening into a long, narrow tunnel. He carefully climbs down the few rungs of a short metal ladder and jumps off when he reaches the bottom. He finds himself standing in a long, damp chamber. Ahead of him stretches a wide paved path, lined on both sides by enormous carved snake heads, their stone mouths forever gaping open. As Harry walks forward, he approaches the massive carved head of a bearded man, eerily illuminated with an emerald-green light. The giant head's reflection shimmers in the water beneath it. He sees, to his horror, the still figure of a girl lying prone on the wet stone floor. Urgently, he runs towards her and kneels beside her motionless body. Her face is pale, her eyes closed, giving her a ghostly appearance. Harry, alarmed, looks around the chamber and sees Tom Riddle lurking in the shadows. Riddle picks up Harry's wand. Harry quickly gets to his feet and extends his hand defensively. Riddle, with a smug expression, uses Harry's wand to write fiery letters in the air. Harry stares in disbelief at the glowing words. They glare at each other with intense anger. Their attention is suddenly drawn upward. A majestic phoenix drops something into Harry's hand. The handsome bird swiftly swipes away down the chamber. Harry unrolls the crumpled sorting hat in his hand, looking at it in surprise and bewilderment. Riddle, unfazed, stretches out his hand. The mouth of the enormous bearded statue begins to open menacingly. Harry watches, a mix of fascination and horror on his face, as the giant stone mouth opens wider and wider. A gigantic serpent starts to slither out into the chamber. Harry, in a moment of panic, drops the hat and runs for his life. The serpent splashes through the water beneath the statue, slithering ominously in pursuit of Harry, who trips and falls in his frantic attempt to escape. Harry cowers on the ground, shielding his head with his arms, as the serpent prepares to strike. Suddenly, Fawkes, the phoenix, reappears. The brave bird flies directly at the serpent's head, flapping its wings powerfully; with great courage, it pecks repeatedly at the gigantic creature's huge yellow eyes. Riddle calls out angrily, frustrated by the interference. Fawkes swoops off, leaving Harry scrambling to his feet. He backs away cautiously as the serpent thrashes its head violently. The massive creature senses Harry's footsteps and lunges forward with deadly intent. Harry makes a desperate dash for safety, splashing through a shallow pool with the enormous serpent close behind, relentlessly pursuing him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Lockhart is abruptly and unexpectedly propelled upwards, only to crash into the solid roof of the expansive and cavernous cave, then he plummets straight back down to the ground below. The cave’s ceiling begins to tremble, shudder, and eventually collapse under the disturbance and impact of Lockhart's collision. Meanwhile, the previously narrow passageway that lay between Ron and Harry becomes completely blocked off by fallen debris and rubble. Harry, peering intently through a tiny, barely-visible gap in the obstructing rocks, sees Lockhart lying sprawled out on the ground, gazing skyward with a vacant smile. Nearby on the ground, a loose stone catches Harry's attention; he picks it up. Ron, reacting swiftly to the situation, snatches the stone from Harry's grasp and uses it decisively to hit Lockhart over the head. Meanwhile, Harry sets about climbing over the fallen debris, driven by a determination to find a way through the blockage. Gripping his wand securely in his hand for both light and protection, he begins to explore the dimly-lit interior of the cave. Ahead of him on the wall, he notices a circular hinged door elaborately decorated with an intricate pattern of entwined snakes. He moves cautiously toward it and begins to speak softly. One of the snakes on the door glides smoothly around the circumference, unlocking the cleverly hidden mechanism. Gradually, the heavy metallic door swings open with a loud creak. Holding his wand up defensively as a precautionary measure, Harry proceeds warily through the now-open circular entrance into a long and narrow tunnel. He carefully descends a short metal ladder, climbing down the few rungs, and jumps off when he reaches the bottom. He finds himself standing in a vast, damp chamber. Ahead of him stretches a wide and paved path lined on either side by enormous carved snake heads, their stone mouths gaping open eternally. As Harry walks forward along the path, he approaches the massive carved visage of a bearded man, eerily illuminated with a glowing emerald-green light. The giant head's reflection shimmers and dances in the water beneath it. To his horror, he sees the still form of a girl lying prone on the wet stone floor. Urgently, he rushes towards her and kneels beside her motionless body. Her face, pale and ghostly, bears closed eyes, enhancing her spectral appearance. Harry, deeply alarmed, glances around the shadowy chamber and sees Tom Riddle lurking ominously in the shadows. Riddle picks up Harry's wand; Harry rapidly gets to his feet and extends his hand defensively. Riddle wears a smug expression and begins to use Harry's wand to write glowing, fiery letters in the air. Harry stares in disbelief at the illuminated words. They glare at each other with intense anger and hostility. Their attention is suddenly drawn upwards. A majestic phoenix descends rapidly, dropping something into Harry's hand. The handsome bird then swiftly sweeps away down the chamber. Harry unrolls the crumpled sorting hat now clutched in his hand, looking at it with surprise and bewilderment. Riddle appears unfazed and stretches out his hand commandingly. The mouth of the enormous and bearded statue begins to ominously open, menacingly expanding. Harry watches with a mix of both fascination and horror etched on his face as the giant stone mouth opens wider and wider. A gigantic serpent starts to slither out into the chamber, its presence overwhelming. Harry, in a sudden moment of panic, lets the hat fall to the ground and runs frantically for his life. The serpent, splashing menacingly through the water beneath the statue, slithers ominously in pursuit of Harry, who trips and falls in his frantic attempt to escape. Harry cowers on the ground, shielding his head protectively with his arms, as the serpent prepares to strike with deadly precision. Suddenly, Fawkes, the brave phoenix, reappears. The courageous bird flies directly at the serpent’s massive head, flapping its wings powerfully; with remarkable bravery, it pecks determinedly and repeatedly at the gigantic creature’s huge yellow eyes. Riddle shouts out angrily, his frustration mounting due to the interference. Fawkes swoops away, leaving Harry scrambling to his feet once again. He backs away cautiously while the serpent thrashes its head violently, trying to recover. The massive creature senses Harry’s retreating footsteps and lunges forward with deadly intent. Harry makes a desperate dash for safety, splashing frantically through a shallow pool of water with the enormous serpent close behind, relentlessly pursuing him as he runs.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Lockhart ascends rapidly, propelled into the air before colliding forcefully with the ceiling of the cave, from which he then plummets back down to the ground with a thud. This impact on the cave roof initiates a sequence of events where the structure begins to deteriorate, stones and debris tumbling down, effectively sealing off any passage between Ron and Harry. Observing this new obstacle, Harry attentively peers through a minuscule gap in the piled rocks. Meanwhile, Lockhart, now prone on the ground, displays a vacant smile, seemingly detached from his surroundings. With a sluggish movement, he reaches out and grasps a nearby stone, only for Ron to swiftly intercept his motion and seize the stone from him, subsequently using it to strike Lockhart over the head with a decisive thud. Once Ron has dealt with Lockhart, Harry begins the arduous task of maneuvering over the array of fallen rocks, carefully ensuring his footing as he goes. With his wand clenched firmly in his hand, ready for any potential threats, Harry embarks on an exploration of the cave's interior. His attention is soon captured by a circular hinged door, adorned intricately with a serpentine pattern, standing prominently ahead on the wall. Driven by curiosity, he cautiously approaches the door and begins to speak. As his words resonate in the air, one of the crafted snakes on the door comes to life, gracefully undulating around the perimeter of the circle, slowly unlocking the intricate mechanism. With a creak of metal, the substantial door swings open, granting access to whatever lies beyond. Exercising caution, Harry holds his wand defensively as he ventures through the newly revealed circular threshold, entering a long and narrow tunnel. Carefully descending a short metal ladder, he reaches the bottom with a light jump and finds himself within an expansive, damp chamber. The path before him is wide and paved, flanked on either side by immense carved heads of snakes, each with open stone mouths, seemingly frozen in a perpetual, threatening gape. Moving forward, Harry approaches a colossal sculpture of a bearded man's head, dramatically bathed in an eerie green light which reflects off the water pooled at its base. It is there that he notices the still form of a girl, lying motionless on the wet stone floor. Urgency grips him as he runs to her side, dropping to his knees, and noting her pallor and closed eyes with mounting concern. His focus shifts momentarily as he looks around the chamber, catching sight of Tom Riddle lurking in the shadows. Riddle nonchalantly picks up Harry’s wand, prompting Harry to rise quickly to his feet, extending his hand in a silent demand for its return. Riddle, instead, uses the wand to trace glowing letters in the air, which hang fiery and bright as Harry stares, their differences culminating in a tense, angry glare exchanged between them. Their attention is abruptly drawn upward as a phoenix swoops down, dropping an object securely into Harry's hand. The majestic bird then glides away, leaving Harry to unfurl a crumpled sorting hat, eyeing it with a mix of surprise and confusion. Meanwhile, Riddle extends his hand with a commanding gesture, and as if responding to his will, the mouth of the monumental bearded statue begins to part. Harry watches with a mix of dread and fascination as the massive stone mouth gapes wider and wider, eventually releasing a gigantic serpent into the chamber. The sight of the emerging serpent prompts Harry to drop the hat and sprint away, trying to evade the slithering menace. The serpent, unencumbered by the water, pursues him with alarming speed through the watery expanse before the statue, its movements full of sinister intent. In a moment of panic, Harry stumbles, landing hard, and instinctively curls up to shield his head and body as the serpent looms threateningly above him, poised to strike. In a dramatic turn, Fawkes reappears, the phoenix launching itself at the serpent’s head, bravely flapping its wings to maintain its position, and beginning to peck relentlessly at the creature’s massive yellow eyes. Fueled by frustration, Riddle shouts angrily, but the phoenix, undeterred by these cries, retreats after its attack. Seizing the opportunity, Harry scrambles back onto his feet, cautiously retreating as the serpent, deprived of sight, thrashes its heavy head in confusion. The serpent, sensitive to vibrations, detects Harry's movements, surging forward in a new attempt to seize him. With urgency now propelling him, Harry rushes through the knee-deep shallow pool, the massive serpent trailing dangerously close behind, leaving chaos in its wake.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Lockhart flies upwards, hits the cave roof, and falls, causing it to collapse and block the passage between Ron and Harry. Peering through a gap, Harry sees Lockhart smiling vacantly on the ground, picking up a stone, which Ron then uses to knock him over the head. Harry climbs over the fallen rocks, exploring the cave with his wand. He discovers a snake-patterned circular door, speaks to unlock it, and steps through the opening into a long tunnel. Descending a metal ladder, he enters a damp chamber lined with giant carved snake heads. As he approaches a massive, illuminated carving of a bearded man, he spots a girl lying still on the floor and runs to her side. Noticing her pale face and closed eyes, he stands up to see Tom Riddle in the shadows, who writes in the air with Harry's wand. They lock eyes angrily until Fawkes, the phoenix, drops something into Harry's hand and flies away. Surprised, Harry unrolls a crumpled sorting hat. Riddle stretches out his hand, causing the statue's mouth to open, releasing a gigantic serpent. Harry drops the hat and runs, pursued by the serpent until he falls. Just as the serpent is about to strike, Fawkes returns, attacking the creature's eyes. As Riddle calls out angrily, Fawkes swoops away, allowing Harry to scramble to his feet and back away. The serpent, sensing his footsteps, lunges forward, forcing Harry to dash through a shallow pool with the serpent close behind.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Lockhart, a flamboyant wizard known for his charm more than his competence, flies upwards, hits the roof of the cave and falls. The cave roof, which is unstable due to magical disturbances, starts to collapse. The passage between Ron and Harry, two close friends and allies in many adventures, is completely blocked. Harry peers through a tiny gap in the rocks, seeking any sign of his friend. Lying on the ground, Lockhart smiles vacantly, his memory addled from a backfired charm. He picks up a stone absentmindedly. Ron, usually the more cautious of the duo, grabs the stone and hits him over the head with it in frustration. Harry climbs over fallen rocks, his determination driving him forward. Holding his wand, an essential tool for any wizard, in his hand, he starts to explore the cave. On the wall ahead, he sees a circular hinged door decorated with an intricate pattern of snakes associated with ancient magical protection. He goes towards it, and starts to speak in Parseltongue, the rare ability to communicate with snakes. One snake, animated by his words, glides around the circumference, unlocking the ancient mechanism. The heavy metal door swings open. Holding his wand as protection, Harry walks warily through the circular opening of the long and narrow tunnel. He climbs down the few rungs of a short metal ladder, relics from previous explorers, and jumps off at the bottom. He finds himself in a long, damp chamber, reputed to be the lair of the legendary monster. Ahead of him runs a wide paved path lined on either side by huge carved snake heads, their stone mouths gaping open as if ready to swallow intruders. Harry walks towards the massive carved head of a bearded man, believed to represent Salazar Slytherin, illuminated with a green light emanating from hidden enchantments. The head is reflected in the water beneath, adding an eerie symmetry to the scene. He sees the still figure of a girl lying on the wet stone floor, Ginny Weasley, whose disappearance sparked the urgent search. He runs towards her and kneels beside her, concern etched on his face. Her face is pale and her eyes are closed, victim of dark magical forces. Harry looks around and sees Tom Riddle in the shadows, a dark presence from the past reanimated through a diary. He picks up Harry's wand, a symbol of bravery and unity due to its connection with Harry's own history. Harry gets up and holds out his hand, demanding his wand back. Riddle writes fiery letters in the air with Harry's wand, revealing truths about his identity. Harry stares at him, the realization dawning. They glare angrily at each other, caught in a timeless battle of good versus evil. They both look up as Fawkes, a majestic phoenix known for its loyalty and healing abilities, drops something into Harry's hand. The handsome bird swipes away down the chamber, leaving behind the glimmer of hope. Harry unrolls the crumpled sorting hat, a symbol of Hogwarts' unity, and looks at it in surprise, unsure of its purpose in the perilous situation. Riddle stretches out his hand, commanding the attention of the chamber. The mouth of the huge bearded statue starts to open, revealing the entrance to the monster's hiding place. Harry watches in fascinated horror as the huge stone mouth opens wider and wider, allowing a gigantic serpent, the feared Basilisk, to slither out. Harry drops the hat and runs, recognizing the deadly threat. The serpent splashes through the water beneath the statue, its presence a menacing shadow of ancient evil. It slithers ominously after Harry, who trips and falls, desperation driving his every move. Harry cowers, protecting his head, as the serpent prepares to strike, the end seeming inevitable. Fawkes suddenly reappears, a beacon of hope. The phoenix flies at the serpent's head, flapping its wings; the brave bird pecks repeatedly at the other creature's huge yellow eyes, determined to save Harry. Riddle calls out angrily, frustrated by the interference. Fawkes swoops off, having accomplished its task. Harry scrambles to his feet, adrenaline surging through him. He backs away as the serpent, in its blind fury, thrashes its head. The serpent feels his footsteps and lunges forward, relying on its other senses. Harry makes a dash for it, survival instinct prevailing. He splashes through a shallow pool with the huge serpent close behind him, the outcome still uncertain.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Lockhart flies upwards hits the roof of the cave and falls. The cave roof starts to collapse. The passage between Ron and Harry is completely blocked. Harry peers through a tiny gap in the rocks. Lying on the ground Lockhart smiles vacantly. He picks up a stone. Ron grabs the stone and hits him over the head with it. Harry climbs over fallen rocks. Holding his wand in his hand he starts to explore the cave. On the wall ahead he sees a circular hinged door decorated with a pattern of snakes. He goes towards it and starts to speak. One snake glides around the circumference unlocking the mechanism. The heavy metal door swings open. Holding his wand as protection Harry walks warily through the circular opening of the long and narrow tunnel. He climbs down the few rungs of a short metal ladder and jumps off at the bottom. He finds himself in a long damp chamber. Ahead of him runs a wide paved path lined on either side by huge carved snake heads their stone mouths gaping open. Harry walks towards the massive carved head of a bearded man illuminated with a green light. The head is reflected in the water beneath. He sees the still figure of a girl lying on the wet stone floor. He runs towards her and kneels beside her. Her face is pale and her eyes are closed. Harry looks around and sees Tom Riddle in the shadows. He picks up Harry's wand. Harry gets up and holds out his hand. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. He writes fiery letters in the air with Harry's wand. Harry stares at him. They glare angrily at each other. They both look up. The phoenix drops something into Harry's hand. The handsome bird swipes away down the chamber. Harry unrolls the crumpled sorting hat and looks at it in surprise. Riddle stretches out his hand. The mouth of the huge bearded statue starts to open. Harry watches in fascinated horror as the huge stone mouth opens wider and wider. A gigantic serpent slithers out. Harry drops the hat and runs. The serpent splashes through the water beneath the statue. It slithers ominously after Harry who trips and falls. Harry cowers protecting his head as the serpent prepares to strike. Fawkes suddenly reappears. The phoenix flies at the serpent's head flapping its wings. the brave bird pecks repeatedly at the other creature's huge yellow eyes. Riddle calls out angrily. Fawkes swoops off. Harry scrambles to his feet. He backs away as the serpent thrashes his head. The serpent feels his footsteps and lunges forward. Harry makes a dash for it. He splashes through a shallow pool with the huge serpent close behind him.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Lockhart flies upwards hits the roof of the cave and falls. The cave roof starts to collapse. The passage between Ron and Harry is completely blocked. Harry peers through a tiny gap in the rocks. Lying on the ground Lockhart smiles vacantly. He picks up a stone. Ron grabs the stone and hits him over the head with it. Harry climbs over fallen rocks. Holding his wand in his hand he starts to explore the cave. On the wall ahead he sees a circular hinged door decorated with a pattern of snakes. He goes towards it and starts to speak. One snake glides around the circumference unlocking the mechanism. The heavy metal door swings open. Holding his wand as protection Harry walks warily through the circular opening of the long and narrow tunnel. He climbs down the few rungs of a short metal ladder and jumps off at the bottom. He finds himself in a long damp chamber. Ahead of him runs a wide paved path lined on either side by huge carved snake heads their stone mouths gaping open. Harry walks towards the massive carved head of a bearded man illuminated with a green light. The head is reflected in the water beneath. He sees the still figure of a girl lying on the wet stone floor. He runs towards her and kneels beside her. Her face is pale and her eyes are closed. Harry looks around and sees Tom Riddle in the shadows. He picks up Harry's wand. Harry gets up and holds out his hand. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Blanchard hovers sideways, nudges the ceiling of the barn and bounces. The barn ceiling begins to implode. The hallway between Tim and George is entirely shut off. George squints through a small slit in the timbers. Resting on the floor, Blanchard chuckles dreamily. He picks up a branch. Tim snatches the branch and taps him on the elbow with it. George slides over scattered timbers. Holding his shovel in his fingers, he begins to investigate the barn. On the surface ahead, he notices a square bolted trap adorned with a design of lizards. He approaches it, and begins to whistle. One lizard twirls around the perimeter, disabling the contraption. The light wooden trap slams ajar. Clutching his shovel for defense, George strides cautiously into the square entrance of the wide and vast passage. He descends the numerous steps of a tall wooden staircase and hops off at the peak. He finds himself in a wide, dry chamber. Before him stretches a narrow grassy trail bordered on either side by tiny sculpted lizard tails, their metal jaws widely shut. George strides towards the enormous sculpted tail of a clean-shaven woman bathed with a blue glow. The tail is mirrored in the soil below. He notices the silent silhouette of a boy resting on the dry wooden ground. He dashes towards him and sits beside him. His skin is flushed and his mouth is ajar. George glances around and notices Gina Turner in the brightness. She seizes George's shovel. George rises and stretches out his elbow. She scribbles glowing symbols in the dirt with George's shovel. George blinks at her. They blink crossly at one another. They both glance down. The raven delivers something into George's elbow. The mottled feline skims away up the chamber. George unfolds the squashed silver trumpet and gazes at it in wonder. Turner extends his elbow. The jaw of the tiny clean-shaven figure begins to shut. George observes in amused thrill as the tiny wooden jaw shuts narrower and narrower. A minuscule worm creeps in. George tosses the trumpet and strolls. The worm paddles through the soil above the figure. It crawls delicately before George, who skips and saunters. George cringes, exposing his elbows, as the worm prepares to dance. Mocha promptly vanishes. The raven dances with the worm's tail, flapping its talons; the timid feline scratches softly at the same being's tiny pink nose. Turner beckons gently. Mocha hops on. George crouches to his knees. He leans away as the worm flicks its tail. The worm hears its whispers and reaches backward. George takes a walk for it. He dances over a shallow pit with the minuscule worm far ahead of him.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Lockhart flies up, hits the cave roof, and falls as it collapses, blocking Ron and Harry's path. Harry, with his wand, explores the cave, finding a snake-patterned door. Speaking to it in Parseltongue, he opens it and enters a long tunnel, arriving in a damp chamber lined with carved snake heads. He spots a pale girl on the stone floor and runs to her, noticing Tom Riddle in the shadows, who takes his wand. They confront each other until a phoenix drops something into Harry's hand. Riddle summons a gigantic serpent from a statue's mouth to attack Harry. Harry runs but trips, cowering as the serpent approaches. Fawkes the phoenix attacks the serpent, allowing Harry to escape as the serpent lunges after him through a shallow pool.
